194
CHAPTER ■7 Categorical Logic
Finally, we can see that A propositions also do not always validly convert.
From a proposition with the form “All Sis P,” we may not always infer its
converse, which has the form “All Pis S.”
SPPS
A:  All S is P.Converse of A:  All P is S.
